if you can get the CM11 in decent condition, it'd be worth it (esp at $10!). The heyu program can take a schedule file (that you write) and compile into macros and load it in the CM11 so that your computer doesn't have to be on.

The CM11a comes with a cable. One end looks like a phone jack, the other is a 9-pin serial port connector. Recent computers may no longer have 9-pin serial port connectors, but you can get a 9-pin to USB adapter.
where the printer cable would plugin before usb was used for everything?
The printer cables (before USB) had 25-pin connectors. Serial ports used to have 25-pin connectors, too, but then went to smaller 9-pin connectors.
